transcripts.text: Questions and doubts are a common and necessary part of every journey.  They help find the best answers to life's hard questions and to challenge long-held beliefs that might not actually be true or proven or healthy.  They can keep us from harm or help us to escape bad situations.  Sometimes, our questions and doubts can set us free, but they aren't easy, and these trying times can make us feel even more disconnected, desperate, and alone.  But you are not alone.  Recovering from Religion is an organization comprised of people just like you.  People who have asked questions, who understand doubt, who can help you navigate through the confusion, and who are genuinely there to help.  24 hours a day, any day, you can reach out for encouragement and support.  on the telephone, or via online chat.  And RFR even provides online communities to connect with others just like you, even if you choose to do so anonymously.  Recovering from religion is a safe place where you can reach out, explore your questions, converse with a friend, and be completely yourself without fear.  No judgment, no rejection, just an opportunity to connect with someone who understands.  There's no reason to go it alone.  Recovering from religion is ready whenever you are.  Reach out today at recoveringfromreligion.org.
